page.title: 01The Area West of Duxford
page.content: This area marks the edge of the chalk belt running from Baldock to Newmarket, and is gently undulating. Land is used for crops - mainly cereals or sugar beet - with some areas of grassland for hay or silage. The M11, northwards from Stumps Cross to the A45 Cambridge Northern Bypass, provides rapid north-south access. Industry in the nearby village of Duxford is science-based (Ciba-Geigy, and Techne) and recently Volvo BM UK Ltd has set up its UK headquarters. The Imperial War Museum houses its reserve collection in the hangers of the former RAF Duxford aerodrome and the 'superhanger' houses the larger civil and military aircraft; flying displays are given during the summer and local people join other volunteers in restoring and maintaining vintage and veteran non-flying aircraft.
